title.rendered: The original Minecraft can now be played in the browser for free

content.rendered:
The cult game Minecraft celebrates its 10th anniversary this year. On May 17, 2009, developer Mojang released the first version of the popular block game. Microsoft has now published this original version as a browser version that can be played for free.

Play like ten years ago

In the classic Minecraftlike ten years ago, is inventory is limited to 32 different blocks. These are different types of stone and wood, blocks of sand and glass, and blocks of wool in different colors. If you feel lonely in your block world, you can invite up to nine friends to stack via a link.

Some today Minecraft-Fan will be surprised if he remembers the originalMinecraft puts, because a lot has changed in a decade of development. The browserMinecraft on the other hand, it still has all the bugs that existed back then and it has also improved optically over the years.

One game mode has now become five

The only mode at the time, the Creative Mode, has now become five. The survival mode was the first new mode to be added in 2009. For him it was no longer just a goal to build everything. A new life bar forced the player to collect resources. There are now also many more materials, animations, textures and lighting effects.

Minecraft has changed a lot in ten years

More about Minecraft

In Minecraft the player can build constructions from mostly cube-shaped blocks in a 3D world. Originally released as an open world for the PC, the game is now available on almost every platform. If you count them all Minecraftversions combined, the game has now sold over 155 million copies.

About the author: Andrew Storm is a freelance journalist and writes for IGN Germany. You can also follow him on his private blog Games Guide.
